profile_data.summary: A machine learning and computer vision engineer with 3 years of professional experience in developing Multi-modal Deep Learning, GenAI and Vision algorithms for AR, VR, smart devices with proficiency in Pytorch and Python. Passionate about developing SOTA ML research to enable impactful applications. Initiative-taking, driven, active team contributor and innovator.
profile_data.headline: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, LLM, LVM | Qualcomm | MS in ML and Image Processing, UMich

experience.description:
Spearheading developing cutting-edge transformer-driven multi-modal deep learning and computer vision algorithms that efficiently fuse multiple modalities with camera. 

Leading multiple project outcomes, mentoring research engineers, collaborating with client and software teams.

Skills include very strong mathematical foundation, software proficiency and knowledge of sensor-physics and camera optics. Algorithms ranging from advanced Kalman filters to adaptively pooled convolutional neural networks; Lucas-Kanade optical pyramids to advanced object detection.

experience.title: Engineer

experience.description:
This research is aimed at mathematical development and analysis of cutting-edge matrix completion techniques that relax the classical assumptions of independence of sampling mask from the underlying data and uniformly random sampling.

Most real-world applications do not follow either of the most fundamental assumptions and my work attempted to derive theoretical guarantees of successful matrix completion under relaxed assumptions. My series of experiments have showed promising results leading to a paper being invited by the Thirtieth European Signal Processing Conference.
experience.title: Researcher

experience.description: Successfully led a team of four graduate students in design and implementation of image deblurring algorithm that jointly recovers a crisp image and the blur kernel. Demonstrated that our implementation of CNN-initialized Majorize-Minimize algorithm with Huber's majorizer accurately recovers a de-blurred image with outperforming PSNR and MSE errors compared to the traditional pure deep learning or pure optimizer approaches. Benchmarked five algorithms against publicly available datasets.
experience.title: Project Lead

experience.description: Student researcher under professor Laura Balzano in the area of matrix completion for sampling patterns that do not satisfy classical assumptions.
experience.title: Researcher

education.description:
Master's student at Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Department, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor with research specialization in Machine Learning, Signal and Image Processing. My primary research focus is developing novel Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms.

Learn more at: https://nisarg-tr.github.io/web/

education.schoolName: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology, Surat

publications.name: Truncated Matrix Completion - An Empirical Study
publications.description: Low-rank Matrix Completion (LRMC) describes the problem where we wish to recover missing entries of partially observed low-rank matrix. Most existing matrix completion work deals with sampling procedures that are independent of the underlying data values. While this assumption allows the derivation of nice theoretical guarantees, it seldom holds in real-world applications. In this paper, we consider various settings where the sampling mask is dependent on the underlying data values, motivated by applications in sensing, sequential decision-making, and recommender systems. Through a series of experiments, we study and compare the performance of various LRMC algorithms that were originally successful for data-independent sampling patterns.

member.occupation: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, LLM, LVM | Qualcomm | MS in ML and Image Processing, UMich
Qualcomm Wireless R&D || Masters from University of Michigan , Ann Arbor

publications.name: Modelling & Steady State Compliance Testing of an Improved Time Synchronized Phasor Measurement Unit Based on IEEE Standard C37.118.1
publications.publisher: IEEE - Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
publications.description:
Upon completion of a six-month research project, I prepared & published a Research Paper at the IEEE International Conference IICPE- 2018. 

This research article proposes an economic and improved Phasor Measurement Unit - PMU model optimized for accurate steady state performance based on recursive discrete Fourier transform (DFT). 

It provides improved results and detailed analysis of the proposed PMU model as per the steady state compliance specifications of IEEE standard C37.118.1. Results with accuracy of 10^(-13) are obtained through the developed PMU model for both nominal and off-nominal frequency inputs in steady state.

member.occupation: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, LLM, LVM | Qualcomm | MS in ML and Image Processing, UMich

projects.description: Blind image deblurring aims at jointly recovering the blurring kernel as well as the sharp latent image, from a blurred image. This is a challenging problem due to complexities involved in initialization and iterative optimization, yet it has tremendous application if solved well. In contrast to recently popular learning-based methods, we developed a fully interpretable, mathematical algorithm that uses Majorize-Minimize method and produces average PSNR improvement of 9 Decibels and NRMSE reduction of 19%, which is substantially superior than a black-box, CNN-based method published in CVPR 2020. Further, the latent sharp image recovered by our algorithm is smooth and free of visual artifacts compared to the CNN estimates.
projects.title: Mathematical Algorithm for Blind Image Deblurring

member.occupation: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, LLM, LVM | Qualcomm | MS in ML and Image Processing, UMich

projects.description:
We developed a multi-objective reinforcement learning algorithm that optimizes two contradictory goals: minimizing economic costs and maximizing human health - by efficiently imposing COVID-19 lockdowns. A stochastic Susceptible-Infected-Recovered (SIR) model describes the disease dynamics, calibrated using real pandemic data of the state of Michigan. A multi-objective Markov
decision process (MOMDP) finds Pareto-optimal policies by striking balance between the two contradictory goals in an iterative process. The code of our algorithm has been made publicly available in the attached URL.
projects.title: Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning for Optimal COVID-19 Control

member.occupation: Senior Engineer, Machine Learning, LLM, LVM | Qualcomm | MS in ML and Image Processing, UMich

projects.description: This project developed a powerful weakly supervised, Multiple Instance Learning - MIL algorithm to detect abnormal events in CCTV surveillance footage. We implemented a deep regression network that learns temporal annotations itself and eliminates the bottlenecks of strongly supervised learning (labour-extensive and error-prone annotation of each video frame). Our algorithm achieved 0.93 AUC score and 0.2 false alarm rate on a real-world ShanghaiTech dataset, which is at par with state-of-the-art methods published in CVPR 2018 and IICME 2020.
projects.title: Weakly Supervised Learning for Anomaly Detection in Real-world CCTV Footage
